critique: The document discusses an amendment to Civil-Service Rule V, section 4, adding subsection (g) which states that if there are already two members of an applicant's family in public service, the application will not be considered. This suggests a move towards limiting access to public service based on familial connections, potentially impacting social inclusion and diversity. It doesn't directly address ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, or economic regulation.
